dict.string: en
PitBox
$(EXECUTABLE_NAME)
$(PRODUCT_BUNDLE_IDENTIFIER)
$(PRODUCT_NAME)
APPL
$(MARKETING_VERSION)
$(CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION)
LaunchScreen
Main
PitBox needs photo library access to save and share your racing photos and setup sheets.
PitBox saves photos to your library so you can keep your racing memories.
PitBox needs camera access to capture dyno sheets, track conditions, and share race day moments with the racing community.
PitBox uses your location to find nearby tracks and automatically tag your setups with track information.
PitBox uses your location to automatically detect when you arrive at a track and help you find racing events near you.
PitBox uses your location to find nearby tracks and auto-tag your setups with track data.
PitBox uses the microphone to record voice notes about your setup and race conditions.
PitBox uses motion data to analyze your driving performance and track session metrics.
PitBox needs access to your contacts to help you find and connect with other racers you know.
PitBox needs access to your calendar to add race events, track days, and maintenance reminders.
PitBox needs access to reminders to help you stay on top of vehicle maintenance and race prep.
PitBox uses Bluetooth to connect to racing sensors and track data equipment.
PitBox uses Bluetooth to connect to racing sensors and track data equipment.
PitBox uses the local network to sync data with other devices and racing equipment.
PitBox uses Face ID to securely protect your racing data and account information.
PitBox uses Siri to let you access your racing data and setups with voice commands.
PitBox uses speech recognition to let you add voice notes and dictate setup information hands-free.
PitBox needs access to your media library to let you add music to your racing videos.
PitBox uses health data to track your physical performance during racing sessions.
PitBox saves your racing activity data to Apple Health for comprehensive fitness tracking.
PitBox can integrate with your smart garage and workshop equipment.
PitBox uses NFC to read data from racing equipment tags and sensors.
